Carbohydrates are the main substrate for high-intensity physical activity.

Lipids are the substrate for moderate and prolonged physical activity.


For the majority of sportspeople, the recommended nutritional intake is that of the general population.


For more than 3 hours of sporting activity per week, nutritional intake should be adapted by increasing energy intake to cover total energy expenditure (TEE).

question.title: What type of substrate is primarily used for high-intensity physical activity?

option_a.title: Carbohydrates
option_a.description: The primary energy source for high-intensity activities

option_b.title: Lipids
option_b.description: The primary energy source for moderate and prolonged activities

option_c.title: Proteins
option_c.description: The primary energy source for endurance activities

option_d.title: Fats
option_d.description: The primary energy source for low-intensity activities
